title.value: An Online Newton’s Method for Time-varying Linear Equality Constraints
title.justification: The title of the paper as given by the user.
title.quote: An Online Newton’s Method for Time-varying Linear Equality Constraints

extractions.description: The paper proposes the Online Projected Equality-constrained Newton Method (OPEN-M) for online optimization problems with time-varying linear equality constraints. The method achieves sublinear dynamic regret and constraint violation bounds under mild conditions and demonstrates superior performance in numerical experiments compared to state-of-the-art algorithms.

type.justification: The paper presents a new algorithm, OPEN-M, and validates its performance through numerical experiments.
type.quote: Finally, we show OPEN-M outperforms state-of-the-art online constrained optimization algorithms in a numerical network flow application.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on optimization algorithms and their performance.
name.quote: We consider online optimization problems with time-varying linear equality constraints.

name.justification: The primary model introduced and evaluated in the paper.
name.quote: We propose the Online Projected Equality-constrained Newton Method (OPEN-M) to tackle this family of problems.

is_contributed.justification: The paper presents OPEN-M as a new algorithm.
is_contributed.quote: Our main contribution is the design of a novel online optimization algorithm... We propose the Online Projected Equality-constrained Newton Method (OPEN-M).

is_executed.justification: The model's performance is evaluated through numerical experiments.
is_executed.quote: Finally, we show OPEN-M outperforms state-of-the-art online constrained optimization algorithms in a numerical network flow application.

is_compared.justification: The performance of OPEN-M is compared to other state-of-the-art algorithms.
is_compared.quote: We observe sublinear dynamic regret and constraint violation from all three algorithms illustrating they are well-adapted to this problem.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper is given for OPEN-M as it is the contribution of this paper.
